definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Once the tire failure, accompanied the spare tire will come in handy.
sentences.chinese: 一旦輪胎髮生故障，隨車攜帶的備胎就可派上用場。

sentences.english: So you're giving us two spares?
sentences.chinese: 那你能給我們兩個備胎嗎？

sentences.english: Should I check the air in the spare tyre as well?
sentences.chinese: 要檢查一下備胎的氣嗎？

sentences.english: A mounting device is arranged on the last-stage bracket and used for mounting a spare tire.
sentences.chinese: 所述末級支架上設置安裝裝置，用於安裝備胎。

sentences.english: An underfloor tray in the rear covers the spare tire and hides valuables from prying eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一個地板托盤後方包括備胎和皮革貴重物品從窺探。

sentences.english: Our car had a flat tire.
sentences.chinese: 每輛車子應帶一個備胎。

sentences.english: Weld spare wheel housing with the fire wall with an interrupted full weld under shielding gas.
sentences.chinese: 用氣體保護間斷全焊，將備胎罩與防火牆焊接。

sentences.english: Competes immediately stops, Sweden coach helped him to trade a spare tire deftly.
sentences.chinese: 隨即比賽中止，瑞典教練麻利地幫助他換了一個備胎。

definition: lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to let nature take its course (idiom)
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
